np.random.shuffle.description: Randomly shuffles the elements of an array in-place.

attributes.name: x
attributes.description: The array or sequence to shuffle.

attributes.name: axis
attributes.description: The axis along which to shuffle.

returns.name: None
returns.description: This function does not return a value.

behavioralNotes: Modifies the input array in place

explanations.text: We start with a simple list so changes are easy to observe.
shuffle modifies the original array instead of creating a new one.
The order will change, but the elements themselves remain the same.

output: The array order changes after shuffle.
The original array object is modified in place.
The number of elements remains the same.
The exact order is not guaranteed without a random seed.

np.random.permutation.description: Returns a randomly permuted copy of a sequence or array.

attributes.name: x
attributes.description: The input array or integer specifying the range to permute.

returns.name: ndarray
returns.description: A new array containing a random permutation of the input.

behavioralNotes: Does not modify the input array

explanations.text: The original array is defined once and reused.
permutation creates a new array instead of modifying the input.

output: A new array is created with shuffled elements.
Both arrays contain the same elements.
The order of the returned array is not guaranteed.

np.sort.description: Returns a sorted copy of an array.

attributes.name: axis
attributes.description: The axis along which to sort.

returns.name: ndarray
returns.description: A sorted copy of the input array.

behavioralNotes: Does not modify the original array

explanations.text: The input array is defined once.
np.sort returns a new sorted array.

output: A new array is returned in sorted order.
Sorting does not occur in place.

ndarray.sort.description: Sorts the array in place along the specified axis.

attributes.name: axis
attributes.description: The axis along which to sort.

returns.name: None
returns.description: This method does not return a value.

explanations.text: The sort method operates directly on the array.

output: The original array is modified in place.
Elements are reordered into sorted order.

np.copy.description: Returns a shallow copy of an array.

returns.name: ndarray
returns.description: A new array containing a copy of the data.

explanations.text: np.copy creates a new array with duplicated data.

output: A new array object is created.
Only a shallow copy is performed.
